p: Research has shown that at high altitudes, there is significant weight loss, which is attributable to decreased energy consumption mainly due to lack of appetite. A nutraceutical herbal adaptogenic appetizer has been formulated using spray-dried powder of sea buckthorn and apricot pulp along with the extract of Rhodiola, the indigenous medicinal plants of high-altitude Himalayas with exceptionally rich nutritional and pharmacological potential (Fig. 6). The main ingredients include Hippophae rhamnoides, Prunus armeniaca and Rhodiola imbricata. It is rich in flavonoids, polyphenols, sterols, vitamin C, vitamin E, riboflavin, niacin, isorhamnetin, rosavin and carotene. The formulation improves digestion and appetite and augments serum antioxidants.
